image.altText: Ross Fox wearing a dark business suit, sitting at a small with four energetic school students writing in their notepads.

items.synopsis: Universities will be given two years to overhaul their education degrees or risk losing their accreditation as part of a national bid to fix Australia's teacher shortage.

title.children: Dissatisfied with university teaching degrees, Ross retrained more than 1,000 teachers. The results were huge

image.altText: Mitch Marsh closes his eyes as he holds his bat and helmet up

items.synopsis: It came out of nowhere and ended just as abruptly, but Mitch Marsh's incredible century proved critical on a day that England found new Ashes life in some Mark Wood thunderbolts.

title.children: Mitch Marsh's magnificent fever dream keeps Australia alive on rollicking day one at Headingley

image.altText: Commissioner Catherine Holmes, ex pm Scott Morrison, ex ministers Alan Tudge and Stuart Robert, bureaucrat Kathryn Campbell

items.synopsis: Commissioner Catherine Holmes faced the unenviable task of reviewing about a million tendered documents and hundreds of hours of evidence over nine weeks of public hearings. Follow live.

title.children: The final report on the unlawful Robodebt scheme has been delivered to the governor-general

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: This is the first key step of today's proceedings. From here, the report will be tabled in parliament and released to the public.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: The final Robodebt report has been handed to the governor-general

children.content: This is the first key step of today's proceedings.
From here, the report will be tabled in parliament and released to the public.

image.altText: A teenager in Balgo poses with her hands in piece signs near the dam.

items.synopsis: Last summer, feuding between different groups in the Western Desert town of Balgo saw brawls break out in the streets. But an innovative new youth program has helped turn things around.

title.children: How a town lowered burglary and theft by 75 per cent

image.altText: England captain Ben Stokes puts his arm around an angry Joe Root in the field during an Ashes Test.

items.synopsis: Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow dropped crucial chances for England as Mitch Marsh capitalised and Mark Wood hit top speed on his return. Here are the five things you missed overnight on day one of the third Ashes Test at Headingley.

title.children: Five quick hits — Sloppy fielding costs England dear as two players make triumphant Test returns

image.altText: A man wearing a green and yellow shawl leans over a grave while holding a photo of his son.

items.synopsis: Baruch's only son was suddenly killed in military action. Now he's fighting for permission to use his son's sperm to create a grandchild.

title.children: Hours after his son died, Baruch had a plan to extract his sperm and keep his grandparenting dreams alive

image.altText: Commuters pile on into a train carriage with open doors

items.synopsis: An investigation is launched into a major suspension of services on the Sydney train network after a signaller called in sick and a replacement could not be found.

title.children: Sydney Trains apologises for system chaos caused by one sick staff member

image.altText: Torn pieces of paper forming the head shoulders and obscured faces of a doctor with a face mask and stethoscope

items.synopsis: Almost 730 registered health professionals were accused of inappropriate behaviour or sexual misconduct by patients in the last financial year, new figures reveal.

title.children: Hundreds of doctors and nurses are accused of sexual misconduct. It is an improvement on the year before

image.altText: A young Indigenous man skydiving with a young woman. The man is smiling and gesturing to Uluru, pictured below.

items.synopsis: Skydiving isn't always how Marley imagined he'd get his kicks, but ever since he was a kid, he's been chasing the thrill.

title.children: Struggling with drugs and alcohol, Marley was given a birthday gift that would change the course of his life

image.altText: A middle-aged Indigenous woman with long dark hair stands behind a lectern filled with microphones.

items.synopsis: Earlier, the government was putting much faith in "the vibe" to carry the Voice – a general appeal to righting the wrongs of the past and giving Indigenous people the opportunity to be heard. Now the government is desperate to arrest the slide, writes Michelle Grattan.

title.children: The new 'prime target' in government's battle to stop the slide in Yes vote

image.altText: A screenshot showing Australian cricketers walking through the Lord's Long Room, with Usman Khawaja talking to a member.

items.synopsis: Fans in the Long Room at Lord's will face movement restrictions and more space between them and players as the MCC continues to investigate the explosive second Ashes Test.

title.children: MCC announces new restrictions for Lord's Long Room following second Ashes Test fallout

image.altText: Mischa Perz stands wearing a black top and pinke beanie, in the boxing ring

items.synopsis: A Melbourne gym owner has fears for the future of her business amid a lengthy stoush over parking with construction workers from the neighbouring West Gate Tunnel Project.

title.children: Gym owner fights back amid lengthy parking stoush with tradies

image.altText: A missing person poster of a Hispanic teenage boy, showing his name and a table with descriptive information.

items.synopsis: A few days after Rudolph "Rudy" Farias IV was found unconscious outside a Houston church, police say he and his mother had spent eight years maintaining the ruse he was a missing person.

title.children: 'Missing' man Rudy Farias spent eight years with his mother hiding his existence

image.altText: A set of shelves with papers and a collection of wigs laid out on them.

items.synopsis: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, who last month brokered a deal to end an armed mutiny in Russia, says Russian mercenary leader Yevgeny Prigozhin is no longer in Belarus.

title.children: Prigozhin is not in Belarus, Lukashenko says, as Moscow shows off wigs, guns and fake ID from Wagner boss's home

image.altText: A composite of three images: Anthony Albanese smiling in a suit, Margot Robbie smiling, and Ash Barty smiling

items.synopsis: It's time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: From Barbie to the Taliban, and drugs in the White House

image.altText: Liam Broady puts his hands to his ears on Centre Court at Wimbledon

items.synopsis: Stan Wawrinka set up what looms as a potentially epic showdown with Novak Djokovic and Australia's men recorded a trifecta of victories but the day belonged to the most unlikely of local British heroes as Centre Court erupted for a massive upset.

title.children: Murray mound? Make it Broady's boulder. Wimbledon erupts as local hope records huge upset on Centre Court

image.altText: A screengrab from a YouTube video which shows a rhinoceros walking through a Nepalese town.

items.synopsis: After riots erupted across France this week, social media was awash with out-of-context videos purporting to show rhinoceroses, zebras and ostriches running through the streets of Paris.

title.children: CheckMate: Did wild animals roam the streets of Paris during recent days of unrest?

image.altText: The ASX close to steady in early trade as seen on the exchange's board at its Sydney office

items.synopsis: The ASX is set to follow Wall Street's lead and dive at the start of the trading day, after strong labour market data out of the US increased the likelihood of a Federal Reserve rate hike to curb inflation. Follow live.

title.children: Rate hike fears cause sharp losses on Wall Street after resilient US labour data, ASX set to plunge

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It would be remiss not to mention the major news happening today, and that's the final report into the devastating Robodebt scheme is being handed down today. The report by Commissioner Catherine Holmes will outline who was responsible for the unlawful debt recovery scheme, which ran from 2015 to 2019 under the Coalition government. After reviewing hundreds of hours of evidence over nine weeks of public hearings and around a million tendered documents, Commissioner Holmes is also expected to rule why legal warnings were dismissed or ignored. The Commissioner could also recommend investigations into potential breaches of the public service Code of Conduct. The report will be tabled in Parliament this morning before it is made public. My colleagues Kelsie Iorio and Dan Colasimone are covering the report's findings and fleshing it out in a dedicated blog, which you can follow below:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Happening today: Findings of the Robodebt royal commission to be delivered

featuredLink.title: Live: The final report into the disastrous Robodebt scheme will be released today. Here's what we know

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen arrived in Beijing overnight, where she will spend the next four days meeting with Chinese officials and business leaders. The trip comes amid trade tensions between the US and China, but there's little expectation it will do much to thaw the icy relations. Secretary Yellen is the second US official to travel to Beijing in recent weeks, after US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited China in mid-June and met with Chinese President Xi Jingping. In a series of tweet, Secretary Yellen said she was looking forward to "deepening communication between our two countries on a range of issues".
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen arrives in Beijing to meet with Chinese officials

children.content: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen arrived in Beijing overnight, where she will spend the next four days meeting with Chinese officials and business leaders.
The trip comes amid trade tensions between the US and China, but there's little expectation it will do much to thaw the icy relations.
Secretary Yellen is the second US official to travel to Beijing in recent weeks, after US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited China in mid-June and met with Chinese President Xi Jingping.
In a series of tweet, Secretary Yellen said she was looking forward to "deepening communication between our two countries on a range of issues".

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: I know what you're thinking — Birkenstocks and a finance blog are oil and water — but stick with me here. Reports from Bloomberg suggest that a private equity firm backed by the parent company that owns the German sandal maker is considering strategic options — and that includes an initial public offering (or IPO, if you're up with the lingo). L Catterton, which is a private equity firm backed by LVMH (a mammoth corporation behind major luxury brands), is working with advisers on potentially listing Birkenstock in the US. Discussions are ongoing, and the deal may not proceed, but Bloomberg's reporting suggests Birkenstock could be valued at more than $US6 billion ($9 billion). Birkenstock sold a majority stake to L Catterton in 2021, with the deal at the time valuing the sandal maker at $US4.35 billion ($6.5 billion). L Catterton has declined to comment on the reports, and at the time of writing this, LVMH and Birkenstock haven't responded to requests for comment from Reuters.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Birkenstock valued at more than $9 billion ahead of possible IPO

L Catterton
, which is a private equity firm backed by LVMH (a mammoth corporation behind major luxury brands), is working with advisers on
potentially listing Birkenstock
in the US.
Discussions are ongoing, and the deal may not proceed, but Bloomberg's reporting suggests
Birkenstock could be valued at more than $US6 billion
($9 billion).
Birkenstock sold a majority stake to L Catterton in 2021, with the deal at the time valuing the sandal maker at $US4.35 billion ($6.5 billion).
L Catterton has declined to comment on the reports, and at the time of writing this, LVMH and Birkenstock haven't responded to requests for comment from Reuters.

image.altText: Jai Hindley looks down

items.synopsis: Jai Hindley cracks on the Col du Tourmalet to surrender the Tour de France yellow jersey as Tadej Pogačar wins stage six ahead of Jonas Vingegaard.

title.children: Jai Hindley explodes on the Tourmalet to surrender yellow jersey

image.altText: Two Year 12 students use laptops at John Paul College.

items.synopsis: Mobile phones and smart watches will be banned from all state schools, in a move to bring Queensland's policy in line with the rest of the country.

title.children: Mobile phones and smart watches to be banned in all Queensland state schools, government confirms

image.altText: A photo of a white submersible under water.

items.synopsis: OceanGate, the US based company that managed the imploded Titanic submersible, suspends all exploration and commercial operations.

title.children: Titanic sub operator suspends expeditions after deadly implosion

image.altText: Ice in the ocean

items.synopsis: Over the past few weeks, climate records have shattered across the globe. So what's going on with the climate, and why are we seeing all these records tumbling at once? asks Kimberley Reid.

title.children: Why are so many climate records breaking all at once?

image.altText: A snow covered ski resort with people walking around in padded clothes

items.synopsis: Light snow started falling on Thursday afternoon and should continue through Friday, before increasing at the weekend when a powerful cold front crosses south-east Australia.

title.children: Half-metre dump predicted for Australia's snow resorts — but skiing conditions might not be ideal

image.altText: Alyce Tippett explains what she loves about motorsport

items.synopsis: What will it take to pave the way for female V8 supercar drivers to compete in Australia's biggest motorsport events?

title.children: Alyce dreams of competing with the best in her field. She hopes being a woman won't stop her

image.altText: A young woman dressed in T-shirt, shorts and sneakers sits cross-legged on dry grass and speaks to two police officers.

items.synopsis: The climate activist refused to follow police orders to leave Malmö harbour in June while protesting the use of fossil fuels.

title.children: Greta Thunberg charged over anti-oil protest in Sweden

image.altText: A finger supports the head of an unconscious sugar glider which is lying on a surgical cloth.

items.synopsis: After three years of operation and more than 4,000 animal patients, the Byron Bay Wildlife Hospital fears it may close after the state government withdrew a funding offer.

title.children: Last-minute funding backflip a 'bitter pill to swallow' for Byron Bay Wildlife Hospital

image.altText: kangaroos and hay

items.synopsis: Farmers in NSW's west say they haven't seen numbers like these since the early years of the last drought, but long-term data shows the population has halved over 20 years.

title.children: Roos rise to 'plague proportions' on farms as harvesters struggle to make dent

image.altText: Graphic showing AFL stadium at Mac Point superimposed over historic goods shed which is in the same spot

items.synopsis: A historic goods shed in Hobart that's in the exact spot of a proposed AFL stadium could soon be given heritage protection — and that could be a problem for the arena project.

title.children: Hobart is getting a new stadium — but a unique piece of Australian rail history is in the way

image.altText: Elderly woman turns her eyes to the side to look at camera with bandana on head

items.synopsis: A trauma resource kit has been entirely developed by a group of senior Warlpiri women to help their community take the first steps towards healing.

title.children: 'We've got to keep them safe': Women work to break community's cycle of childhood trauma

image.altText: A group of women with microphones dancing on stage

items.synopsis: The organiser of a Blackpink concert in Hanoi apologises after its website featured a map showing China's territorial claims in the South China Sea, as Vietnam authorities launch an inspection into the incident.

title.children: Blackpink embroiled in latest South China Sea controversy
